title: Profane Cheerleader Post Wins Protection
itunes:title: Profane Cheerleader Post Wins Protection
description:
First Amendment expert Eugene Volokh, a professor at UCLA Law School, discusses the Supreme Court ruling that a public high school violated the Constitution when it punished a 14-year-old cheerleader for a profane Snapchat rant.

Former federal prosecutor George Newhouse of Richards Carrington discusses the Supreme Court ruling that police can’t automatically pursue fleeing misdemeanor suspects into homes without warrants.

June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
content:encoded:
